name: UPSC
description: The UPSC Exam 2026 for Prelims is scheduled to be held on May 24, 2026. This highly anticipated competitive exam is conducted annually by the Union Public Service Commission to recruit candidates for various posts in the Government of India. With focused preparation, discipline, and determination, candidates can successfully qualify the UPSC CSE Exam 2026.
questionPaperPattern: The exam consists of Prelims (MCQs), Mains (descriptive), and Interview. Prelims has Paper I (General Studies, 200 marks, 200 questions, objective, negative marking -1/3 per wrong answer) and Paper II (CSAT, 80 questions, 200 marks, qualifying with 33% minimum). Mains has 9 papers (2 compulsory language papers, 1 essay, 4 general studies papers, 2 optional subject papers), total 1750 marks. Interview/personality test carries 275 marks. Final merit = Mains + Interview (2025 marks).
posts: Indian Audit and Accounts Service, Group ‘A’
Indian P&T Accounts and Finance Service, Group ‘A’
Indian Railway Protection Force Service, Group ‘A’
Indian Revenue Service (Customs & Indirect Taxes) Group ‘A’
Armed Forces Headquarters Civil Service, Group ‘B’

name: JEE
description: Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) is a national-level engineering entrance assessment conducted for admission into IITs, NITs, IIITs, and other prestigious institutes. It is one of the toughest exams globally, conducted in two phases – JEE Main and JEE Advanced. More than 12 lakh candidates appear every year for around 11,000 seats in 23 IITs.
questionPaperPattern: The exam is objective-based (MCQs and numerical questions) with negative marking. JEE Main is computer-based (online), while JEE Advanced is held in a combination of formats as decided by IITs.

eligibility.nationality: Indian citizens (or eligible foreign candidates as per guidelines)

age.relaxations: Reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC-NCL, PwD) have age relaxations as per rules

eligibility.education: Candidates must have passed Class 12 (10+2) or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics.

examOverview.conductingBody: National Testing Agency (JEE Main), IITs (JEE Advanced)
examOverview.vacancies: Around 11,000 seats in 23 IITs, along with NITs, IIITs, and GFTIs
examOverview.applicationFee: Varies by category and gender (₹650 for General Male candidates, reduced for females and reserved categories)

posts: Engineering seats in other top institutes through JEE Main rank

name: NEET
description: The National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) is the sole medical entrance exam in India for admission to MBBS, BDS, BAMS, BHMS, BSMS, BUMS, BVSc & AH, and other undergraduate medical courses in government and private institutions. It is one of the largest exams in the world, with more than 20 lakh candidates appearing every year.
questionPaperPattern: The exam consists of 200 objective-type questions (MCQs), of which 180 need to be attempted. Each correct answer carries 4 marks, and 1 mark is deducted for every wrong answer.

eligibility.nationality: Indian citizens, OCI, NRI, and foreign nationals (as per official guidelines)

age.relaxations: Reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC-NCL, PwD) have age relaxations as per rules

eligibility.education: Candidates must have passed Class 12 (10+2) or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Biotechnology, and English as core subjects.
eligibility.attemptLimit: No limit on the number of attempts (as per latest guidelines)

examOverview.vacancies: Approx. 1,00,000+ seats across MBBS, BDS, AYUSH, and Veterinary courses

posts: Nursing and Allied Health Sciences (selected institutes)
